libros.descripcion: Chronicles the life and accomplishments of Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web.
Discusses the origins and evolution of the Web, offers insights into the current state of the Web, and shares a blueprint for the future
The books have a lively design, engaging text and photos, questions to get children thinking and talking and teaching notes.

This is the story of Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the Web, from his birth in London, England, to his physics studies at Queens College, Oxford, and his work as a software engineer at CERN in Geneva.
Originally published as Foundations and trends in web science; vol. 1, issue 1.
